content: doing all this publication has reminded me that I need to get this organised. This is what I need to know when publishing IGs

Requesting publication of an IG for the first time (must be done with first NIB):
- name
- github repository / simplifier project name
- code for IG
- realm
- 2 sentence description of purpose/scope of IG
- 1 paragraph description of purpose/scope of IG
- 1 paragraph about sponsors/involved parties for IG

With NIB of re-ballot of an IG
- has name changed: - why? - new name:

When providing content for publication - must send actual form with:

  • agreed version (e.g. 0.2.0) of IG that is being published
  • change notes (1 or more bullet points about what has changed)

and if have changed:

  • 2 sentence description of purpose/scope of IG / 1 paragraph description of purpose/scope of IG
  • 1 paragraph about sponsors/involved parties for IG
I'm not sure what the best way to integrate this into the process is

further, after several publication issues: I am no longer going to accept publication requests unless the IG is using the IG auto-publisher. Also, I have published 2 IGs from simplifier that raise a number of questions about publication quality criteria
Will you be sharing the publication quality criteria questions raised?
want to talk about those on the call
One of the problems I've got with this ballot publication cycle is that at least one group of editors have been using the wrong IG publisher. They've been using the version available from here:
which refers to an old orphaned version of the IG publisher from before we decided to always use the trunk version
I would like to replace the link there with a pointer to the current build of the IG publisher. Does FMG think I can just do that, or does it need to be a technical correction?
policy issues: we've said before that I can fix broken external links without it being a technical correction - but this isn't quite the same thing
